summary: 1- Sansa stood there watching as people were dying by the thousands and she still wanted to stand firmly in place because she...
question: 1- Sansa stood there watching as people were dying by the thousands and she still wanted to stand firmly in place because she didn’t want to abandon her people. Later, Sansa was determined to lay down her life in order to protect the people in the crypts from the wights that got reanimated. She has bled for the North, she risked her life to get it back, she has been fearlessly defending it from an crazed invader with nukes, and she was ready to lay down her life for it’s people.
answer:
2- She outlived all her abusers and enemies. She literally took out Littlefinger by playing his own game against him ! Years of manipulation and abuse later, Sansa didn’t bown down to anyone, won her fight for the North independance and became Queen in her own right. But of course for white feminists it doesn’t matter since Sansa isn’t an imperialist, a white savior and don’t fight with a sword like Arya or Brienne.

Anonymous said: all I’m seeing is people once again devaluing sansa because she’s feminine. fighting with swords is cool but it does not mean you’ll be a good leader. war mongering is bad and should not be considered as a qualification for leadership.

anonymous asked: Sansa is the first lady of Winterfell and first queen in the north in her own right. she killed her husband after waging war against him, was the primary political opponent to Daenerys, tried to become a kingmaker, fed the smallfolk, opened her castle to them and prioritised the wellbeing of her people. but sure this isn’t great or feminist unlike the imperialistic white saviour becoming queen.

Yes!

And I think it’s more than just being feminine in terms of her appearance, it all goes back to people (not so) secretly hating Sansa for not being silent and compliant to the whims of everybody around her the way she had to be as a hostage; it’s the double sin of being conventionally feminine and not being like… soft and vulnerable and easy to victimize or abuse anymore. It’s like they expect Sansa to apologize for growing up and becoming more aware of the world and not being as naive as she was as a literal child and most of all, being aware of what she brings to the table and refusing to sit down and shut up. Like how dare a young woman believe in her worth and capability to lead and stand up for herself and her people even she isn’t a physical fighter and probably never will be?

I don’t even think that in real life, women that are GNC are privileged for being GNC either, especially if they’re not straight (or straight passing, it’s a weird distinction). It’s just that in media, particularly when they’re portrayed as straight and given hot male love interests, the vast majority of the audience will prefer them to conventionally feminine female characters because they see the latter as weaker. Plus there’s the whole rebellion against the norm is more worthy than (perceived) conformity even if that rebellion isn’t even intentional or meant to make a point. I just never think that conforming to non-conformity for the sake of being different does any good but that’s just me. Does that even make sense? I know it’s a weird nuance haha.

But yeah, Sansa does the groundwork for being a real leader which includes the boring stuff like making sure people are fed and clothed and like, not going to riot. Remember how Bran was listening to the concerns of farmers and all when he was lord of Winterfell in Robb’s stead? That’s what leaders have to do and Dany just doesn’t do it. I’m not saying Dany started out having a terrible heart because yeah, at the beginning she was an abused kid, but like, her sitting on top of the pyramid in Meereen while the people below were forced to sell themselves back into slavery was rather indicative of what she was all about and it wasn’t a leader but rather a conqueror.

summary:
how ruthless are the gentle - 
“Am I ‘your grace’ so soon? Not a few hours ago you called me by name.”
“I did, but you just...
body:
how ruthless are the gentle - 

“Am I ‘your grace’ so soon? Not a few hours ago you called me by name.”

“I did, but you just requested my services in an official capacity, therefore I must oblige.”

He wanted to play, she could see it, but Sansa was tired, the letters in her pocket were heavy and felt hot as a brand against her thigh, and her hand itched beneath her glove.

“I see I have upset you.”

Sansa startled. “Of course not, I-“

“My apologies cousin. I was just teasing.” He said warmly, and Sansa felt both foolish and wrong-footed. For a brief but intense moment, she wanted to explain to him that by this time of the day her hand started to itch and that she usually retired somewhere private, where she could apply the ointments on her burns, or they would trouble her for the rest of the night. That after a day spent in company, some hours to herself in the silence of the godswood were a gift, a solace and something she badly needed. Just that one bit of the day that was her own. She opened her mouth to speak but she had no words to say all these things with, appropriate words that would explain without giving so much away, so she promptly pursed her lips closed and gulped.

“I realize I may have given offense, but I promise I am not-“

“Never mind him, Sansa. You’re free to go, as always.” Dany said, pushing at Jon’s shoulder a little, looking genuinely annoyed at him. “Jon’s just being an arse.”

“And to make up for it.” Jon stepped to her side and offered his arm. “Allow me to escort you to the sept, my Lady.”

“I pray in the godswood at this hour.” She took his arm as a reflex.

“Then that is where I’ll take you.”

blog.name: acourtofhopeanddreams
blog.title: Enjoy the little things!
blog.description:
Open your heart
To the love of the world
It only needs one person
Touching it with 
A word
A look
A smile
A kiss

summary: The Four Seasons of Love
title: The Four Seasons of Love
body:
Written for @jonsadreamofspring Day 1 based on the prompt “Seasons”

Spring is not as beautiful anymore as it used to be. And even Summer beyond the wall doesn’t bring back the magic. But when Autumn arrives it holds a promise: Winter is Coming and when Winter Comes, Jon comes home.

Canon Compliant // Post-Canon

Spring

Winterfell looked more beautiful now than it had ever been. The castle was bathing in the rays of sunshine melting the snow away and small flowers in a million different colours appeared out of nowhere. The smiles on the Northerners’ faces brightened even more and each and every day more people visited the great hall to deliver some of their fruit and other goods to their queen.

And each and every day Sansa thanked them from the bottom of her heart, even though anyone could see that her eyes were never smiling along. Because each and every day she still caught herself turning to the empty seat next to her at the dinner table. Or she woke up in the morning mumbling something and expecting an answer that never came. Whenever she strolled through the hallways, filled with life and laughing people, she forgot that the dark black curls she loved so much wouldn’t all of a sudden appear. And during her council meetings she heard a voice in her head, surprisingly much like his, challenging her opinions and arguing with her, even though she knew deep down that she was right.

Spring had always been her favourite time of the year. She had laughed with her friends, braiding each other’s hair and crowing themselves with self made flower crowns. But Spring had now lost a little of its magic, a little of its beauty and a little of its gleam. Because Jon was not there with her.

Summer

The songs sung around the burning fire were a little happier. And the food they shared was a little less scarce and a little more filling. But the ground around them, as far as they could see, was still covered in layers of snow and they were still huddling together and basking in each other’s warmth to sleep at night. If the wildlings beyond the wall would ever have to choose a motto, it would certainly be something about Winter never being truly gone or only love and freedom being able to warm a cold heart.

Sansa would be able to come up with something great and witty and clever. Within a few hours she would have a sketch of a sigil and the new inspiring words written down beautifully.

Here, up North and beyond the wall, he had been somehow happy. He had found things he had never thought he would find and he was surrounded by people who loved and liked him and didn’t care about titles or the lack thereof.

And yet, even this place, licking its wounds and slowly healing, was not as beautiful as he remembered it to be. It wasn’t as magical. It wasn’t as enchanting. And not even the rays of the Summer sun could warm the cold part of his heart. It was as if the layer of eternal snow covering the ground also covered his heart. Because Sansa was not here with him.

Autumn

During the long Summer she had wondered if Winter would ever be coming again. Maybe there was no Winter without the Night King and his army. But Sansa recognised the change before anyone else even noticed that Summer was slowly fading and the rays of sunshine were slowly weakening and the days were slowly shortening.

He would have seen it. He would have known. He would have repeated her father’s words, the Stark promise. He would have known that not even the defeat of the Night King could erase something older than time and more true than anything else. Winter was coming. Winter was still coming.

Sansa used to wish as a child that Summer would never end, but now she was happy to see the leaves changing colour, to hear the howling wind circling around the castle and to feel the cold rain on her bright red hair.

Autumn was a promise, and not just about Winter coming, but about something else coming too, about someone else coming too. And the less bright the sun burned and the more flowers disappeared and hid in the cooling ground, the warmer her blood rushed through her veins and the stronger her heart beat in her chest.

Winter was coming. And just like Winter had driven the Night King and his army south, it would now force the Wildlings to come back and find shelter too. And Jon would be and come with them.

Winter

It hadn’t been this cold for a very long time and yet his entire body was glowing. There were barely enough blankets to keep the Northerners and the Wildlings warm and yet pearls of sweat rolled down his sweating body. Winter had come and with it snow and ice and shivering. But the Queen in the North and the King beyond the wall, the Wolves, were thriving like never before.

“Will it be like this for the rest of our lives?” Sansa used the soft tip of her finger to draw slow circles on the naked skin of his chest. “A lonely Spring, a meaningless Summer and an endless Autumn without you?”

“Maybe…” Jon wrapped his strong arms around her tender body and he pressed her as close to his chest as humanly possible. He told himself that it was to keep her and himself warm. He told himself that he could let her go when Winter was over again. And yet he knew that he was soothing himself with lies and untruths. “Winter has always been my favourite time anyway.” He kissed her temple and her cheek. He kissed the corners of her mouth and the sensitive spots in her neck.

A soft moan escaped her slightly parted lips and she buried her sharp nails in his back. “I always preferred Spring and Summer.” She whispered and the circling tip of her finger wandered over his chest, around his nipple and bellybutton and even lower. “But if I can only have you in my arms during Winter, I wish this Winter was eternal or would at least last until the last day of our lives.”

summary:
Jon & Sansa parallels 36/∞ : Bastard foreshadowings ?  

"Come back to me after you've fathered a few bastards of your own, and...
body:
Jon & Sansa parallels 36/∞ : Bastard foreshadowings ?

“Come back to me after you’ve fathered a few bastards of your own, and we’ll see how you feel."Jon trembled. ”I will never father a bastard,“ he said carefully. "Never!” He spat it out like venom. - A Game of Thrones, Jon I

“The queen will never let you go, never. You are too valuable a hostage. And Joffrey … sweetling, he is still king. If he wants you in his bed, he will have you, only now it will be bastards he plants in your womb instead of trueborn sons.” - A Clash of Kings, Sansa VIII

“You are a free man now, and Ygritte is a free woman. What dishonor if you lay together?” “I might get her with child.” “Aye, I’d hope so. A strong son or a lively laughing girl kissed by fire, and where’s the harm in that?” Words failed him for a moment. “The boy … the child would be a bastard.” “Are bastards weaker than other children? More sickly, more like to fail?” “No, but—” “You’re bastard-born yourself. And if Ygritte does not want a child, she will go to some woods witch and drink a cup o’ moon tea. You do not come into it, once the seed is planted.” “I will not father a bastard.” - A Storm of Swords, Jon II

“You’re to marry Margaery!” “A king can have other women. Whores. My father did. One of the Aegons did too. The third one, or the fourth. He had lots of whores and lots of bastards.” As they whirled to the music, Joff gave her a moist kiss. “My uncle will bring you to my bed whenever I command it."Sansa shook her head. "He won’t.” - A Storm of Swords, Sansa III

Ygritte was with him, laughing at him, shedding her skins till she was naked as her name day, trying to kiss him, but he couldn’t, not with his father watching. He was the blood of Winterfell, a man of the Night’s Watch. I will not father a bastard, he told her. I will not. I will not. - A Storm of Swords, Jon VI

“The Lord of the Eyrie can do as he likes. Can’t I still love you, even if I have to marry her? Ser Harrold has a common woman. Benjicot says she’s carrying his bastard.” Benjicot should learn to keep his fool’s mouth shut. “Is that what you would have from me? A bastard?” She pulled her fingers from his grasp. “Would you dishonor me that way?” - The Winds of Winter, Alayne I

summary: Im not good editing videos but I know a lot of people here can, so I let you my ideas with GoT soundtrack if someone can make...
body:
Im not good editing videos but I know a lot of people here can, so I let you my ideas with GoT soundtrack if someone can make them would be fantastic:

Power is power

The first parts are all about Jonerys but the rap part is so Arya and have a pieces about Jaime, the main part applies to Sansa and Tyrion aswell, also Cersei.

First part - Jon Snow

Second part - Daenerys Targaryen

Third part (rap) - A combination between Arya Stark and Jaime Lannister.

Last part: Sansa and Tyrion, also Cersei.

Wolf at your Door

This is obviously the Stark Sisters song

First Part: Sansa Stark

Second Part: Arya Stark

Rest of the song: Combination of both

Baptize me, this song is about redemption so is perfect for: Theon, Jaime and Sandor

Love Can Kill, this song fits perfectly for the suffer of all the ships in GoT especially: Jonerys, Gendrya (there are parts like is Arya saying Gendry💔) Gussandei and Braime.

Hollow Crown: Perfect for Queens Sansa, Daenerys and Cersei

Nigthshade: This is about lost bc of war so: House Stark, Lannister, Tyrell, Baratheon and all Daenerys lost.

When I lie: This song fits perfectly for Daenerys, Arya and Cersei and her bit of craziness and how man can’t catch them, it can be from the Jaime, Gendry and Jon perspective.

Too many Gods: Perfect for guys who fight for survival, honor or family but at the end of the day they don’t want the throne or power just survive and their lover ones safe: Jon, Jaime, Gendry, Sandor, Jorah, Greyworm, Davos and Theon.

So if you decides to make a video with these let me know, because when I listen the song I imagine them but I haven’t found videos with their specifically 💔

summary: Sansa AU where she’s not a Mean Girl?
body:
Sansa AU where she’s not a Mean Girl?

Like, being the golden girl is fine - I get that she’s supposed to be set up initially in the books/show as beautiful, talented at all things deemed feminine, naive and unchallenged. But there’s a tendency in some of the AUs that I’ve read to make her into the snobby mean cheerleader type who’s an airhead. But Sansa never goes out of her way to be mean. Like, I get there’s friction between her and Arya, particularly once Joffrey comes into the picture but she’s never a person who goes out of her way to be mean. At the most extreme, I imagine her to be like Elle in Legally Blonde.

For that matter, I’d like to see her as a dreamier, maybe slightly bookworm girl who loves doing dance, reads romances and historical fiction, and gets good grades especially in English, History and Art. That is just as valid AU interpretation as slightly vapid model sister who likes fashion and excitement. (Not there is anything wrong with liking fashion and the perceived glamour of the fast life.)

summary: do you think sansa could have sex with harry before she fled to the north? in winds she seems very foward with the spicy...
question: do you think sansa could have sex with harry before she fled to the north? in winds she seems very foward with the spicy comment, and the charm, bewitch him comment from littlefinger, there are also a lot of mentions of bastards. so sansa could be pregnant after. there is a lot of foreshadowing of sansa birthing a bastard. I know in the show she didn't have a child but the Scarlett O’Hara comment of george make me think that maybe she could have one in the books.
answer:
I recognize the possibility that GRRM intends to keep Harry around, but I won’t acknowledge it. I just don’t like it as a plotline, at all. I also think it’s too bland and straightforward; in Storm, Sansa is engaged to Willas and you could see a clear path from Sansa marrying a Tyrell to then retaking Winterfell, and I think Harry is a similar red herring.

Sansa also isn’t willingly flirtatious with him. He makes her uncomfortable and she thinks to herself that she has to say something to him, it doesn’t come naturally to her. And while she follows most of Petyr’s advice to charm him, she ignores Petyr’s advice to invite outside so they can be alone. Sansa is very witty and likes to verbally spar with people, but she isn’t forward sexually; the reason being that it gives her panic attacks. (I really need to write a post about how certain stans trying to paint our love for Sansa as a Madonna/whore situation is really fucked up considering Sansa doesn’t like sex because she’s a victim of sexual violence, grooming, and domestic abuse). When Petyr first tells her she’s betrothed, she has a hard time breathing and feels her chest tighten. Meeting Harry makes her stomach feel upset, and GRRM describes it a “a sudden terror” coming over her. Sansa has a lot of trauma around sex, but also intimacy. She can play a character, but there are tons of hints that the Sansa hiding behind Alayne is really uncomfortable.

(At some point I’ll probably write a lot more on where exactly I think Sansa’s story is going, but I’d need to re-read a lot of chapters to give a conclusive answer)

And someone correct me if I’m wrong, but I think GRRM using the example of Scarlet O’Hara’s kids long predates any connection to Sansa; he’s been using it as his go-to line for quite some time. It’s an example from a super famous writing that is called the “maxims of adaptation” (or something like that), by the guy who adapted Gone with the Wind (I think?). He wrote something like 5 rules for adapting something from a book to film, and one of them basically boils down to simplify the things that don’t matter so much, and in that he used Scarlet O’Hara’s children as an example. GRRM uses it in a different context, but he probably picked it up from the maxims of adaptation.

summary: Did robb disinherit sansa? If he did how sansa can become lady of winterfell like in the show ? Also if he name jon his heir do...
question: Did robb disinherit sansa? If he did how sansa can become lady of winterfell like in the show ? Also if he name jon his heir do you think it will bother sansa that her bastard born half brother had now her claim just because she was married to a lannister against her will as a child? And how do you think the northern lords will trear her considered the fact she is married to a lannister? Will they support her or treat her coldly and call her lady lannister like stannis?.
answer:
The think that maybe believe she could have a problem with jon being the heir now is that in winds she still see to have a prejudice against bastard even when she is pretending to be one. Feeling offended when they call her a bastard because she is not. And they way she think about harry’s daughter, when he said my daugther in her mind she correct it as your bastard daughter like if that made the child less important and inferior.

Robb’s will is tricky, since we don’t know exactly what he wrote. I don’t think Sansa was “disinherited”, I think Jon Snow was named as Robb’s heir. Meaning she’s still in line, she just now falls below Jon. And if she is disinherited, it would be made clear she was disinherited as Sansa Lannister; and if the show made anything clear, it’s that Sansa and Tyrion’s marriage will be dissolved, one way or another.
Jon being placed above her as a bastard is not going to bother Sansa. She may be bothered that Robb gave Winterfell to someone else, but honestly, I don’t think Sansa losing her claim would bother her; she hates having it, because it gives people leverage to use and abuse her. As long as Sansa can be home in the North and/or Winterfell, she’ll be happy.

Let me elaborate on why I don’t think Jon being a bastard would bother her. One thing to make clear is that everyone in the story has prejudices, and even Jon himself is prejudiced against lowborns (hence him dreaming of his mother as highborn). The heroes of our story are learning to outgrow their preconceived notions though, and while Sansa doesn’t have a modern view on class, she’s not hung up on things like bastardy by TWOW. She thinks in AFFC that it would be so sweet to see him again:

I am a bastard too now, just like him

When she thinks of Harry’s bastard daughter, she clarifies what offends her about that by telling him that his second child has a different mother than his first; Harry tries to talk of his children as if he’s a good or noble man for having a daughter, but Sansa sees it as signs of his arrogance and general asshole-ry.
And when Sansa is embarrassed by Harry in the yard, it isn’t because she views being a bastard as a bad thing; it’s because Harry uses it as an insult. If, in front of your peers, someone called you ugly – even if you weren’t or didn’t think being ugly was a bad thing – it would still embarrass you because whoever said it means it to be embarrassing. Harry is trying to say that Sansa is beneath him, that she doesn’t deserve to show him anywhere because she’s unimportant. Of course she reacts poorly to that, and has a gut reaction to knock him down a peg too since she has the knowledge that using his logic, she shouldn’t be associating with him. It’s one thing to be insulted in a way that’s true, but quite another to have to hold your tongue while knowing your insulter is wrong. But when she responds to him, Sansa asserts her bastard status:

“And now if you will excuse me, Littlefinger’s bastard must find her lord father and let him know that you have come, so we can begin the tourney on the morrow.”

And no, the Northern Lords absolutely won’t have prejudice against her for being forcibly married to a Lannister. Stannis is called out for being the only to actually call her a Lannister, where everyone else knows she’s a Stark. And the Northern Lords don’t like Stannis at all, but they agree to march with him to save Ned Stark’s daughter. Keep in mind, they think that Arya Stark has been married to Ramsay Bolton. But they don’t care; it’s obvious she would have been forced into the marriage, and they want to go save her. They won’t treat Sansa any different.
